Thanks for the quick replies.  A few follow-up questions below:

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:

> Yes, it does. If my article "JUnit: A Starter Guide" didn't mention
> that explicitly, then that's a defect in my article.

Where would I find this article?

> To be sure, Kent's original article, the one in which he introduced
> SUnit, says that plainly. I suggest you read it -- it provides the
> best insight into why xUnit is the way it is.

Is this available via junit.org?  

> Never, ever, ever do stuff in the TestCase constructor. Ever. Ever.
> 
> Ever.
> 
> Use the setUp method *or* wrap the TestSuite in a TestSetup object.
> Mike's FAQ explains this in detail, I believe.

And is this the FAQ on junit.org?

Sorry for the document location questions if they are obvious.  I'm
replying quickly before a meeting. :)

Cheers,

Tom
